text: Hi all quick question for sales, we have a client looking at CMS hub but we would need to integrate the app into the site would we need enterprise or pro to do this?

That would 100% depend on what their app is that they want to integrate, and how much stuff they want to migrate into HubSpot directly right now.

For example: a bank typically has an <http://app.bankname.com|app.bankname.com> site for the logged-in experience because they will use a proprietary system for banking. But their website would be hosted fully on HubSpot. In that scenario they could even get away with CMS Hub Free.

If the use-case is something like a learning management system, you could build it fully in CMS Hub Enterprise.

*What’s their app do?*

Hi, everyone. I'm trying to figure out why one of my CSS files is minified, and one isn't.
<http://www.anura.io|www.anura.io>

Ok, thank you!
So, this one that isn't minifying is where I'm adding the stylesheet that I'm constantly updating.
The other one I have never updated. So, that makes sense.
Should I add the file I'm regularly updating separately? Because that main-head.css contains several other CSS files I'm not updating, and then at least they'd be minified.
I mean generally it’s best not to have monolithic CSS and JS files in todays web

This is a good read if you want to learn more
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CMXUWUY5D/p1622577827040500>
Is it possible to sync Website/Landing pages from a production account to a sandbox account?
